intro: Wittmackia gregaria, commonly known as the silverleaf pohuehue, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces striking clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are thick, waxy, and have a silvery underside, giving it its common name. Wittmackia gregaria is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
